bullying.title: 4-7-8 Breathing Exercise
bullying.description: Inhale through your nose for 4 seconds, hold for 7 seconds, exhale through your mouth for 8 seconds. Repeat 4 times.
bullying.reason: Activates the parasympathetic nervous system to reduce stress and anxiety caused by bullying

bullying.title: Grounding Exercise
bullying.description: Name 5 things you can see, 4 things you can touch, 3 things you can hear, 2 things you can smell, 1 thing you can taste.
bullying.reason: Helps return focus to the present moment and reduce negative thoughts from bullying

bullying.title: Self-Compassion Statement
bullying.description: Write or say to yourself: 'I deserve to be treated kindly. This painful feeling is valid, and I will get through it.'
bullying.reason: Builds self-empathy that is crucial for resilience when dealing with bullying

bullying.title: Safety Plan Creation
bullying.description: Create a list of trusted people you can contact when feeling unsafe. Include phone numbers and best times to reach them.
bullying.reason: Provides a sense of control and support when dealing with bullying situations

bullying.title: Positive Affirmation Practice
bullying.description: Choose 3 positive affirmations like 'I am strong', 'I deserve happiness', 'I am worthy'. Repeat each 5 times while looking in the mirror.
bullying.reason: Combats negative thoughts from bullying with positive affirmations that build self-confidence

bullying.title: Journaling About Strengths
bullying.description: Write down 5 strengths or achievements that make you proud. Focus on positive things you've done.
bullying.reason: Helps shift focus from negative bully words to achievements and personal strengths

bullying.title: Support Network Mapping
bullying.description: Create a map of your support network: family, friends, teachers, counselors. Identify who you can contact for various types of support.
bullying.reason: Helps realize that you are not alone and have a strong support system

bullying.title: Boundary Setting Practice
bullying.description: Practice saying 'no' firmly: 'I don't like being treated that way, and I choose to leave.' Practice in front of a mirror.
bullying.reason: Helps build self-confidence for setting healthy boundaries with others

bullying.title: Gratitude for Positive Relationships
bullying.description: Write down 3 people in your life who always support you and how their support makes a difference.
bullying.reason: Helps remind you that there are good people around you despite bad experiences with bullies

bullying.title: Creative Expression
bullying.description: Express your feelings through images, music, or creative writing. Let emotions out through positive channels.
bullying.reason: Provides a healthy outlet for processing strong emotions without harming yourself

bullying.title: Mindful Self-Defense
bullying.description: Learn mental self-defense techniques: ignore negative comments, focus on your goals, build self-confidence through small achievements.
bullying.reason: Helps develop mental resilience against negative words and behaviors from others

bullying.title: Positive Role Model Visualization
bullying.description: Imagine yourself as a strong and confident person. What would that person say or do in a bullying situation?
bullying.reason: Helps build a positive self-image and provide inspiration for handling difficult situations

bullying.title: Digital Detox from Social Media
bullying.description: Turn off social media notifications for 2 hours. Focus on offline activities that make you happy.
bullying.reason: Reduces exposure to negative comments online that can worsen bullying experiences

bullying.title: Physical Activity Release
bullying.description: Do physical activity like running, dancing, or team sports to release negative energy and increase endorphins.
bullying.reason: Physical activity helps reduce stress and improve mood naturally

bullying.title: Professional Help Assessment
bullying.description: Evaluate whether you need professional help. Find out about school counseling services or mental health support.
bullying.reason: Sometimes professional help is needed to address bullying trauma deeply

bullying.title: Hobby Re-engagement
bullying.description: Return to hobbies you enjoyed before experiencing bullying. Dedicate time to do something that makes you happy.
bullying.reason: Helps restore joy and a sense of control over your life

bullying.title: Sleep Hygiene Improvement
bullying.description: Create a good sleep routine: turn off gadgets 1 hour before bed, make the room dark and cool, avoid caffeine in the afternoon.
bullying.reason: Adequate sleep helps increase emotional resilience and ability to cope with stress

bullying.title: Nutrition Awareness
bullying.description: Pay attention to your diet. Make sure to eat nutritious foods that support brain health and mood.
bullying.reason: Good nutrition affects mood and ability to cope with stress

bullying.title: Nature Connection
bullying.description: Spend time in nature: walk in the park, sit under a tree, or look at the sky. Let nature's calmness soothe your mind.
bullying.reason: Connection with nature helps reduce stress and provide a wider perspective

bullying.title: Art Therapy Exploration
bullying.description: Try art therapy: draw your feelings, make collages from positive words, or create music that expresses your emotions.
bullying.reason: Art provides a safe and creative way to process trauma and difficult emotions

bullying.title: Peer Support Seeking
bullying.description: Find peer support groups or online forums where others share similar experiences with bullying.
bullying.reason: Hearing that others experience similar things can reduce the feeling of isolation

bullying.title: Goal Setting Small Wins
bullying.description: Set small goals you can achieve in a week, like 'learn something new' or 'help someone'.
bullying.reason: Small achievements help build self-confidence damaged by bullying

bullying.title: Forgiveness Practice
bullying.description: Forgiveness practice not for the bully, but for yourself. Write how forgiveness can free you from emotional burden.
bullying.reason: Forgiveness helps release negative energy and focus on self-healing

bullying.title: Confidence Building Activities
bullying.description: Try new activities that make you feel competent: online courses, new sports, or creative projects.
bullying.reason: Building confidence through achievements helps counter negative effects of bullying

bullying.title: Mindful Eating Practice
bullying.description: Eat with full awareness: notice taste, texture, and aroma of your food. Avoid eating in front of screens.
bullying.reason: Mindful eating helps develop self-awareness and reduce emotional eating

bullying.title: Digital Boundary Setting
bullying.description: Set rules for social media use: block uncomfortable accounts, limit screen time, focus on positive interactions.
bullying.reason: Prevents cyberbullying and builds a healthier digital environment

bullying.title: Volunteer or Helping Others
bullying.description: Find opportunities to help others, such as tutoring, helping at shelters, or social activities.
bullying.reason: Helping others helps us feel worthy and shifts focus from personal problems

bullying.title: Music Therapy
bullying.description: Create a playlist of music that makes you feel strong and positive. Sing loudly when alone.
bullying.reason: Music has the power to change mood and provide emotional energy

bullying.title: Pet Therapy Consideration
bullying.description: If possible, spend time with pets or visit animal shelters for positive interactions.
bullying.reason: Animal interactions provide unconditional emotional support

bullying.title: Spiritual or Religious Practice
bullying.description: If you have spiritual beliefs, spend time praying, meditating, or practicing religious activities that calm you.
bullying.reason: Spiritual practices can provide a sense of purpose and emotional support

bullying.title: Professional Counseling Research
bullying.description: Find information about counselors or therapists specialized in bullying trauma and youth support.
bullying.reason: Sometimes professional help is needed for comprehensive recovery

bullying.title: Future Self Visualization
bullying.description: Imagine yourself 1 year from now: stronger, more confident, having overcome the bullying experience.
bullying.reason: Visualization helps build hope and motivation to move forward

bullying.title: Letter Writing Therapy
bullying.description: Write a letter to the bully (that won't be sent) to express your feelings, then write a supportive letter to yourself.
bullying.reason: Writing helps process emotions and provide a more balanced perspective
